image.altText: Brindabella Christian College sign.

props.synopsis: The troubled Brindabella Christian College will close one of its campuses from Friday next week, after it was put under voluntary administration last month.

title.children: Brindabella Christian College to close Charnwood campus after voluntary administration decision

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: Convicted rapist and former army officer cadet Jake Sullivan showed no emotion as a statement detailing how his actions left his victim feeling “worthless and broken” was read to the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: 'I had no power': Rape victim criticises criminal justice system

image.altText: ACT Chief Police Officer Scott Lee in the Belconnen Police Station

props.synopsis: ACT police say a trio of masked men orchestrated four targeted shootings in Canberra over a week, leaving one man with serious injuries and killing a pet dog.

title.children: One man injured and dog killed in spate of shootings across Canberra, police say

image.altText: High Court of Australia, building, generic

props.synopsis: The High Court has thrown out a claim by two asylum seekers that they were illegally detained by immigration authorities while their visa applications were being assessed.

title.children: Asylum seekers lose High Court bid for damages

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt sitting in a doctor's clinic.

props.synopsis: With six of Canberra Hospital's 14 orthopaedic surgeons declaring their resignation, the outgoing department head says he's not surprised by their decisions given changes to operational procedures he says "all of the directors of department hate".

title.children: 'House of cards': Sixth orthopaedic surgeon resigns from Canberra Hospital

image.altText: Bottles of Pepsi are pictured at a grocery store in California.

props.synopsis: A High Court hearing for a challenge between PepsiCo and the Australian Tax Office today will be an important test of Australia's laws set up to tax overseas companies appearing to derive profits here.

title.children: PepsiCo faces Australian Tax Office in High Court

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: The ACCC alleged there was anti-competitive behaviour between the CFMEU and a builder on a $600 million project in Brisbane after a subcontractor's contract was terminated. The High Court disagreed.

title.children: ACCC loses High Court appeal over anti-competitive behaviour in $600 million project

image.altText: Two police officers stand talking seriously on a road with cones on it.

props.synopsis: The principal of St Edmund's College in Canberra says two teenage boys who were allegedly hit by a stolen car on Friday morning outside the school are in serious but stable condition, and face "a long road to recovery".

title.children: Father of boy struck by allegedly stolen car helped save other teen, St Edmund's principal says

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Allegra Spender, in a yellow blazer with shoulder-length black hair.

props.synopsis: Independent Allegra Spender is pitching a scheme to help "permanently" cut the power bills of owners and renters through zero-interest loans for home batteries and other appliances, saying the major parties are only offering temporary relief that will expire within months.

title.children: Spender says Coalition's gas plan could influence hung parliament negotiations

image.altText: Elon Musk stands infront of the smashed windows of a Cybertruck

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's electric vehicle company has also been targeted by vandals in recent months amid backlash to his embrace of far-right politics.

title.children: Tesla quarterly sales plummet amid Elon Musk backlash

image.altText: a silhouette of a man in a wheelchair in a room

props.synopsis: Jim* moved into an apartment rented by a disability company linked to suspected NDIS fraudster Khawaja Haroon. He's now facing homelessness and has paid thousands of dollars of his NDIS funding for services he didn't receive.

title.children: 59yo's eviction linked to suspected multi-million-dollar NDIS scam

image.altText: A middle aged woman with her sleeve rolled up and a bandaid on her arm.

props.synopsis: The shingles vaccine could be an effective intervention for dementia, with a large "natural experiment" in Wales finding a substantial drop in dementia risk for those who received the vaccine.

title.children: Shingles vaccine study finds 'huge protective signal' against dementia

image.altText: A woman wearing Islamic dress stands on a pile of rubble and concrete after an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Gaza's health ministry says children are among the dead in an Israeli strike on a UN-run clinic in the strip's north, where people had been sheltering.

title.children: Dozens killed, tens of thousands displaced as Israel signals Gaza land grab

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks into the distance at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The pandemic then the war in Ukraine helped to kick off the current cost-of-living crisis. It will be front of mind for many voters this election, but is there really much politicians can do to ease it?

title.children: Tracking how Australia got to where we are in the cost of living crisis

image.altText: Peter Reith and John Howard in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard has always downplayed involvement in the waterfront dispute, but new evidence raises more questions about the government's knowledge of the events leading up to it.

title.children: New evidence about 1998 waterfront dispute

image.altText: Map showing the path of a cyclone heading towards the Queensland coastline.

props.synopsis: An AI forecast about ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred's path was far more accurate than leading weather models used by meteorological organisations.

title.children: AI picked Cyclone Alfred hitting Qld before traditional weather models

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wearing a sunhat and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Professor Megan Davis says the government has walked away from a treaty process in favour of an economic empowerment agenda for Indigenous Affairs.

title.children: Uluru leader flags 'deeply concerning' shift in Indigenous affairs agenda

image.altText: Screenshot of a scene from Top Gun, where Val Kilmer and Tom Cruise face off dressed in army uniform

props.synopsis: Val Kilmer, who has died at the age of 65 from pneumonia according to his daughter, had a film career spanning four decades, having started as an unknown stage actor in New York.

title.children: From Top Gun to Batman, Val Kilmer threw himself into every role he played

image.altText: camera with glass broken

props.synopsis: A Queensland shire bracing for rising rivers has lost almost a quarter of its important flood-monitoring cameras, thanks, the mayor suspects, to shooters who wrongly believe police are recording them.

title.children: Don't shoot, flood-zone mayor begs trigger-happy camera vandals

image.altText: hands hold an orange alarm clock against a blue background

props.synopsis: Daylight saving finishes for people in NSW, Victoria, South Australia, Tasmania and the ACT and won't return until October 5.

title.children: Daylight saving time is ending this Sunday. Here's what to know

image.altText: Tasmanian restauraunt Mures signage

props.synopsis: Hobart seafood business Mures Tasmania stops serving Tasmanian salmon in its restaurant due to "concerns" over industry practices, which have drawn national attention in recent months.

title.children: Iconic Hobart seafood restaurant removes Tasmanian salmon from menu

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: In a statement, her family says Ms Giuffre's vehicle was hit by a school bus in rural Western Australia, but she returned home before going to hospital.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre remains in 'serious condition', family says

image.altText: Firefighters watch a high energy fire in the Grampians area of western Victoria

props.synopsis: Legislation to replace Victoria's Fire Services Levy with an expanded tax could be voted through by the Legislative Council today, but farmers are calling for it to be blocked.

title.children: Fire levy changes have Victorian farmers fuming ahead of vote

image.altText: Against black background, vibrant coloured flowers sit in individual transparent blocks placed next to each other.

props.synopsis: An impressive exhibition full of hundreds of flowers — painted, sculpted and woven into dresses — makes a powerful point about our connection to the environment, and the value of slowing down to appreciate it.

title.children: Why we turn to flowers at weddings, funerals and to decorate our underwear

image.altText: Back of a woman's head, her hair tied up in a ponytail, in a room with a display cabinet and TV on the wall

props.synopsis: Despite the growing number of adult female prisoners across Australia, advocates say there are few gender-specific support services to help them transition back into the community.

title.children: Women released from prison find 'voice and self-esteem' in support program

image.altText: The entrance to a cave above ground

props.synopsis: After trespassers vandalised Koonalda Cave on the Nullarbor Plain a round-the-clock surveillance system was installed to help protect the nationally significant heritage site.

title.children: Cameras installed following vandalism of ancient Indigenous art

image.altText: Rescuers carry out search and rescue on damaged buildings in the aftermath of an earthquake.

props.synopsis: State-run media in Myanmar announces the military's ceasefire call, which comes after days of pressure from international aid groups and humanitarian organisations.

title.children: Myanmar military announces temporary ceasefire following earthquake

image.altText: Students at the University of New South Wales

props.synopsis: Several Australian universities have closed Confucius Institutes on their campuses, amid ongoing scrutiny about links to the Chinese government. Here is what we know.

title.children: What we know about our universities cutting ties with Confucius Institutes

image.altText: A graphic image shows Khawaja Moeen Haroon, dressed in a dark suit and tie.

props.synopsis: On the western outskirts of Melbourne, where the paddocks meet new homes, lies the centre of an alleged NDIS fraudster's network.

title.children: From taxi driver to mansion owner: How a suspected fraudster built an empire

props.synopsis: The power of the unions has always been a huge battleground for Labor and the Coalition. Now there are revelations about the role former prime minister John Howard and his ministers played in one of the most divisive industrial disputes in Australia.

title.children: The secrets of John Howard's war on the docks

image.altText: Hannah Ferguson

props.synopsis: Gen Z are more progressive than previous generations at the same age, with young women sitting furthest left on the political spectrum.

title.children: Progressive young women could shape this election

image.altText: A woman's arms are visible at a desk which has a calculator, laptop and papers with graphs on it.

props.synopsis: The best place to put any extra money will depend on a few things, including how well you sleep at night when you have debt.

title.children: Is it better to pay extra money into your mortgage, super or elsewhere?

image.altText: A still from a Studio Ghibli animated film showing a young girl in traditional Japanese dress.

props.synopsis: The frenzy to create Ghibli-style art using ChatGPT has sparked a heated debate about the ethical concerns of AI-generated art, copyright issues and the future livelihoods of artists.

title.children: Why is the ChatGPT 'Studio Ghibli' trend problematic?

image.altText: Trump and Musk look out the open driver's side door of a red Tesla

props.synopsis: Australia's News Media Bargaining Code has been name-checked in the annual US Foreign Trade Barriers report, making it a target for Donald Trump's looming "liberation day" tariffs.

title.children: Australia wanted to make Meta and X pay. That might upset Donald Trump

image.altText: An older woman with grey hair and a pink shirt stares into the camera, while sitting on an outdoor lounge.

props.synopsis: Western Sydney, which is a region made up of 14 seats, is considered as integral to the major parties for the upcoming federal election.

title.children: Helen has voted Labor for 40 years. There are a few reasons she won't this time
